website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight multi-tool that is slim and made from cold-forged stainless steel.
pros: Stainless steel construction makes tool less prone to rust
Doesn't take up much room in your saddle bag
A well-built tool with basic functions
cons: This tool only has 8 functions, which is significantly fewer than other bike multi-tools available at the same price point

customer_reviews.title: Quality material
customer_reviews.text: OK, in my busy life I confess the first use was not on my bike. I used one of the small hex keys in emergency to undo a tight TORX screw when I had no TORX wrench to hand. This is a test because a 'cheap' hex wrench would have gotten all chewed up. My new Multitool is unmarked. And completed that odd job :-)
customer_reviews.author: LynnR_MI

customer_reviews.title: Slimline too I can keep close on rides without the bulk.
customer_reviews.text: I love the flat profile of this tool. It comes with a cheap leatherette case which is nice. We will see if it lasts. Regardless, the tools are very low profile so they will be very unnoticeable in my jersey pocket. It states they are stainless also which will be nice with how much I sweat on training rides. The tools individually click into place to keep them separated and ready to use when you open an individual tool.
customer_reviews.author: BPurdy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with this tool. Lots of positive feedback from fellow riders who Have seen me using it. It feels like a well made tool, and unlike others I’ve owned this one doesn’t feel like it will come apart in my hand when I use it. I’ve used it repeatedly adjusting a new saddle, it’s nice having what I need with me.
customer_reviews.author: Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Worst bike tool ever made. There is no way that the positive reviews are real
customer_reviews.text: Worst bike tool ever made. I’m a former pro rider, I have a full shop and have been working on bikes since the eighties! This tool is impossible to handle, all the pieces come out at once and get in the way. Under very very very low torque the side handle snapped, rendering the entire tool useless. Waste of money- do not do not purchase from this company- it is bogus reviews for sure and a completely inferior product to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: G Francois

customer_reviews.title: Best road tool out there.
customer_reviews.text: After 15 years of riding, this bike tool is the best road tool that I've ever owned . The Pro Bike Tool is perfect for quick on the road fixes. It's very slim and fits perfectly in my saddle bag. My seat post slipped a few days ago and that's a large nut to tighten. This baby did it with no strain. It's $20 and you get what you pay for. The price is right. I'm buying another one for my other bike. There is no chain tool, that would change the thinness that I love. I checked Ebay for a better price and and this is the best price.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hanks

customer_reviews.title: NOT RELIABLE!
customer_reviews.text: I used this tool yesterday on loosing up a wheel and it snapped and cut my palm. I am returning it back to Amazon. All of my other bike multi tools are solid and have never snapped. I am disappointed because I really like the size of this tool but its reliability is not there. Its actually dangerous to use in my opinion. My cut could have been a lot worse. EDIT 11/15/17 Contacted the company and they made the situation right. You will not be left out in the cold if you are not happy.
customer_reviews.author: HELIOS

customer_reviews.title: Tem garantia?
customer_reviews.text: I have two tools of this, this is the one I least used and broke this weekend, I did not use 10 times
customer_reviews.author: paulo henrique ferreira martins

customer_reviews.title: Just got it and used it twice on the trail!!
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was how sturdy this is. It has some heft, but not heavy. It's a quality tool. Made very well. Nothing worse than a cheap tool breaking the first time you need it!! I've been there and will always pay a bit more to know that something will preform to my expectations when the time comes. This is the second item I have purchased from Pro Bike Tool. They have earned my trust for a quality product and exceptional customer service. BTW, I have NOT been given anything for free or at a discount for my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: RicijazTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, Support & Service From Pro Bike Tool Again
customer_reviews.text: Yet again very impressed by Pro Bike Tool service and product quality. This little tool is exactly that, small, unobtrusive and easily handled, while feeling robust and comfortable. Tightened my saddle stem and bottle holder immediately and it's now in my crossbar bag. I even got a contact and thank you for the review, thank you guys, great job by all at Pro Bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael John Crossley

customer_reviews.title: Small and convenient
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great for an emergency or something quick & easy but I would not recommend using it for anything more than that. Since it's compact, it isn't good for men's hands ( I used it ok but my boyfriend's medium sized hands were almost too much). Also when you are using it, the other 3 tools from the same side want to pop out next to the one you are currently using.
customer_reviews.author: MissA

customer_reviews.title: Mine snapped while loosening a bolt.
customer_reviews.text: Just like a previous reviewer, the side of mine snapped while trying to loosen a bolt. This tool is lightweight and slim, thus is nice to carry with you. However It's only good for use on anything not requiring a lot of torque. I will not be buying this again, and would stick to a bulkier/heavier/sturdier multitool.
customer_reviews.author: C. Samel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but fiddly and annoying
customer_reviews.text: I've used lots of multi-tools and I like the fact that this one is light & sturdy feeling, a seemingly hard-to-find combo. What I don't like is that it's frickin' annoying to use. As other people have mentioned, the other tools/allen wrenches constantly pop up, so you do one turn, turn back the other tools that have reared their heads, and then rinse and repeat. At this point, I'd gladly have a few more grams to carry if I didn't have to have my fingers snapped by the pieces I'm not using or have to readjust the other stuff every half-turn.
customer_reviews.author: Philip H.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it, but it bent, and doesn’t close anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product, slim sleek, and seemed sturdy. However the more I used it the more I got annoyed with the other components constantly coming out as I am using the tool. Half the time I’m just fiddling around keeping it with just one tool out. The final straw was the top 5mm just bent the whole apparatus. I was using a torque key and was definitely under the max threshold of the key.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lang

customer_reviews.title: This is honestly the worst milti tool I have ever purchesed
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly the worst milti tool I have ever purchesed. Cage snapped in half within the first 2 weeks of being used. Would not recomend for anyone who wishes to tighten something more than a few ft/lbs
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautiful tool. It will take you a little learning curve to find the best way to hold it. Sometimes, the other bits will move out of their position as you are using the tool. However, it is a slim, sturdy, and good looking tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Antoun

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is perfect, it feels great in your hands --no sharp ...
customer_reviews.text: Extraordinary product. Build quality is perfect, it feels great in your hands --no sharp edges--, and it has a nice "snap into position" feature of each of the tools at a 90° degree angle with respect to the body, which is totally useful when you have to apply some torque. I did not expect it to be so good, but it is OVERWHELMINGLY good for the price. It's all you need on the road if you have a reasonably modern bike,but I'm not sure if it will work with a bike from 60s, 70s or 80s, which tend to use different bolts and screws.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Was a favorite... for $20 plus, skip it
customer_reviews.text: Well I preached how good these were. Bought 1 and then another. Second one just fell apart exactly like others have pictured. What a shame. It is perfect sized, tolerences are good. But falling apart in your hand is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Stay at Home Dad

customer_reviews.title: A compact, lightweight, well designed and well made multi-tool!
customer_reviews.text: A superb product exactly as described & shipped as requested. Additionally, I received a customer sales follow up email from the President of Pro Bike Tools (Mike) inquiring if I was satisfied with my purchase and if I had any questions/comments. He also included several useful tips about his products. This is the epitome of exemplary customer service and I greatly appreciate it! Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: MagiSci

customer_reviews.title: Has several tools but hard to hold
customer_reviews.text: I have had two occasions to try using this product since I bought it. In both instances, i encountered the same issue when trying to use this bike tool . It is nice and compact, fits easily in an underseat wedge pouch. But to achieve its compact shape the tools are folded in- standard for a pocket knife or tool. But these tools did not snap/lock into place, making it difficult to get pressure to move screws, etc. I do not recommend this product. Am taking it out of my bike bag.
customer_reviews.author: BethE

customer_reviews.title: Light and simple
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple tool that had everything I would need on the trail without weighing my pack down. This tool is simple, light and effective. Exactly what all of us MTB riders are looking for in our tools.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley D Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for my tandem that does not use the nice cyckit bags but would have really liked to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have rated this tool a 5+ if it was as small as the tool from cykit [...] as it needs to be this small to fit in the cyckit hardshell saddle bag. The Pro Bike tool can do much higher torque than the cyckit one but it is just to big to fit in the cyckit saddle bag. I bought it for my tandem that does not use the nice cyckit bags but would have really liked to have this tool in my cyckit bag on my single bike as well. The Pro Bike tool quality is also high and that is what attracted me to this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Theodor L. Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Does show some rust. Must not be very “stainless”
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent multi tool, but it has shown some rust. I live in the Midwest where we have some very humid summers. I usually hold this on my jersey pocket inside a small bag. It’s either a result of condensation or just getting sweaty, but it does rust. It is still functional, but i’m a little disappointed. To be fair, I have yet to find a small multi tool to carry that doesn’t develop some rust. That’s what Midwest humidity can do.
customer_reviews.author: jrod

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy addition to tool kit for road.
customer_reviews.text: Used it once already and seems sturdy but is torque limited, as are all of this type of tool set. Have to add adjustable wrench and pliers to road tool kit. Reach through spokes to get at certain fittings on my catrike is somewhat limited by compactness of overall unit but I am generally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: OrlandoTom

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to operate.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely manufactured, light and nimble. Difficult to operate. When one tool is being used, the rest keep bouncing out and hindering the usage of the used tool... Springs are very erratic and uncontrollable. In shall try to find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Shmuel Halevi

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used two of the provided tools in this set, but the experience was quite good in general. Pros: As expected, the toolset is intended for the bike. The product's quality is reliable, although I was a little worried when I first saw the simplicity of the toolset. Cons: I was expecting a comfortable handling while using this tool. However, I need to wear gloves to finish up the work or otherwise I might have hurt my hands.​
customer_reviews.author: Mason_Zhu

customer_reviews.title: The Right Tools in the Right Form Factor
customer_reviews.text: They've figured out exactly which tools are needed. I used to have to carry 4 Allen wrenches jangling around in my seat pack. But now I just carry this sleek tool that takes up no room whatsoever. Feels sturdy, I feel confident it will hold up when I need to use it for unexpected roadside repairs. Get this tool, you'll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: K. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Nice light tool
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to like. Can be a little wobbly if not held in bolt head firmly. Quality looks really good
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, handy bike tool.
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Compact. Well-made. Pro Bike Tools makes quality stuff. I have this, a chain tool, and one of their outdoor bike covers. All are well-made and built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty B.

customer_reviews.title: I like the leather case
customer_reviews.text: Quality set of bike tools. Looks elegant and is very practical to use. I like the leather case. Only con: it does not have a flathead screwdriver - no big deal for me, but for others my be worth few stars less...
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Kurzawa

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT TOOL
customer_reviews.text: "The PERFECT TOOL" ...Simple, compact and can take a beating. From my local trails to Park riding, this tool was used more times by many buddies then I ever expected and the reaction of many was just Awesome. I was introduced to it by My Co-worker on a discount offer and I'm glad I did. I'm a Machinist by trade and very impressed by the Quality and Craftsmanship.My Honest Review, Worth every Penny
customer_reviews.author: Juan H

customer_reviews.title: I like this tool because it's flat and the joints are ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality tool. I have previously used cheaper bike tools that look similar online, and the hex key's literally mushroomed and smeared, so soft was the metal. I like this tool because it's flat and the joints are stiff, not floppy. This one was $20, the cheap one that is unusable was $10. Don't be like me and spend $30 dollars when you could spend $20 and be all set.
customer_reviews.author: AFV

customer_reviews.title: Loving how minimal this tool is, not over sized ...
customer_reviews.text: Loving how minimal this tool is, not over sized just for the sake of holding girth in my hand. Just a tool to do the job and its shiny to help keep the rabid raccoons away while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool For The Ride But.......
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool to have on the trail for last minute adjustments, however, I had a situation where I needed a flat head screwdriver. This tool does not have a flat head screwdriver. I almost couldn't believe it and luckily for me, I also carry a small pocket knife which was okay for what I needed. If this tool had a flat head, I'd give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: D Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Small and light weight but feels sturdy while using. Build quality looks nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: jenx

customer_reviews.title: Small, all the tools.
customer_reviews.text: Small and strong. Has all the mostly used wrench and driver sizes. A unique flat a low profile design that fit into overstuffed saddle bag. Already used it for some adjustments during a trip. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gena

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomic design
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping for a lost bike tool and was going to buy what I always have. However this tool really caught my eye. You take somewhat of a chance buying something like this without holding it. The specs convinced me to give it a try. I really like the way it fits in your hand, yet is compact. This is a high quality item that I would have been glad to pay full price for. If I don't lose it I expect it will outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: william t hudnell jr

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - Versatile - Compact
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool, well made of good material and very nicely finished. It is very compact and has all the tools needed for quick/emergency repairs or adjustments while riding. It is reasonably lightweight and fits easily into even small saddle bags.
customer_reviews.author: Rivington

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy design
customer_reviews.text: It snapped the first time I used one of the larger Allen keys. I'm outside my return window so I guess I'm stuck with a piece of rust free junk.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: it works well, sometimes the tools don't stay out in position.
customer_reviews.author: redheadsoup

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight. Great tool for cycling at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Strong!
customer_reviews.text: The Pro Bike tool is compact, sleek and strong. It is now an important staple on my triathlon bike during all training rides.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Martins

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool but......
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. Compact. Case not so great. Cheap "plastic" type material without a way to close the top of the case. Hence, the tool keeps slipping out of the case when it is in my top tube bag.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Seems to be quite durable and strong
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Seems to be quite durable and strong. Last tool like this that I had from someone else when I had to push to get my wheel unlocked it literally broke off in my end in a million pieces.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the on-the-go repairs
customer_reviews.text: When I received I think that the tool frame will be bend over the preassure of my hands trying to do some torque. Completely mistaken, this tool it's extremely hard and durable, perfect for the on-the-go repairs.
customer_reviews.author: David Chaves

customer_reviews.title: Simple tool for daily use good steel.
customer_reviews.text: Simple useful tool made of good material. If you looking for something simple , i carry this in my poket all the time. Size of tictac container.
customer_reviews.author: CyberOp53

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: All the glowing reviews are well deserved. This is a very high quality tool. My only complaint is that it doesn't have the right sized Allen tool to service my Thomson stem! Dang it! But, I love the low profile design because it takes up little space in my under seat bag. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Best Mini Tool by a country mile
customer_reviews.text: So good I ordered another Have tried other reputable mini tools but they cannot compare to the quality let alone the brilliant design of this as it's flat and fits perfectly in the back pocket of my cycling jersey. It also is easier to get into intricate areas and there is no feebleness which I have have found in other mini tools
customer_reviews.author: pointrob

customer_reviews.title: Great bike tool
customer_reviews.text: This bike tool is compact, very sturdy, and has the components I need for a variety of bike checks and routine adjustments. Can't be bettered for the price. The snap-out tools are securely seated, offer two grips and can take a lot of torque. Small enough to fit easily into a pocket--or even a sock. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin T.

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much, but I did replace a pair of pedals the other day and it worked fine to tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this company! Perfect little tool with everything you need. I was actually pleasantly surprised with how small and lightweight it was.
customer_reviews.author: cheycity

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tools. Well made. Includes all the bits I need on a roadside.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Sadly missing 2mm size Allen
customer_reviews.text: Well made tool but needed a smaller Allen to fit SRAM derailer on my bike..bought the Gray Multitool
customer_reviews.author: trlbrkr

customer_reviews.title: Good feedback and tips from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: A quality product for the money. Good feedback and tips from the manufacturer. If you want a minimum weight tool that takes up the smallest space this is a good choice. Looks like it has everything you'd need on the trail but a chain tool - you'll have to decide your level of comfort there. Fit and finish is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: dawjr

customer_reviews.title: But it
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a nice quality. Durable, small, very elegant looking I would say. Very good product
customer_reviews.author: Piotr Lech

customer_reviews.title: Light and compact, but weak.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 3 of these because they are the flattest, lightest foldy that I’ve found. I can’t even tell when it’s in my pocket and I can crash on it without getting the dreaded Park Tool charlie-horse. The drawback, however, is that thin means weak and I’ve broken 2 of these while making trailside repairs. Just be mindful of the amount of torque being applied and you should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tool. Looks and feels good, great quality and fits well in small saddle bag. Used already once on the road to fix loose bottle cage on my friends bike. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is perfect! Light and compact, fits perfectly in saddle bag. First time I put it in I had a mechanical issue and so glad I had this with me!
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool and when i whip it out it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool and when i whip it out it's always a crowd pleaser :) it is very durable, does not rust under sustained sweaty/humid conditions, it is lightweight and very low profile so its barely noticeable in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Supberb Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: This is the second product I have purchased from Pro Bike Tool. The tire pump I purchased was of such quality I knew I would be safe buying the multi tool. In fact, I bought a competitor's tool and it didn't come close and sent it back. I hope my review helps.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure_Some

customer_reviews.title: It is a high quality and has a fine finish. I used it to install water bottle ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a high quality and has a fine finish. I used it to install water bottle holder for my bike and it worked fine. I also like its bag which is small and stylish. I also purchased their bottle holder and it is also very good.  So far they met my expectations
customer_reviews.author: grbz

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, excellent materials
customer_reviews.text: Nice, compact set of useful tools. The materials are nice, the tools are well finished and appear to be accurately sized. Suggestion for Pro Bike Tool: a version with a 1/4" square drive for sockets would be super handy as both a bike and an EDC tool set.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: A 'Classy' bike tool?
customer_reviews.text: The word that comes to mind when handling this tool is 'classy'. Weird word for a bike tool, but it's a super nice, wheel built tool. Light and very flat. I used it for some general tasks on my bike at home enough that it's replaced the Crank Bros tool(which is covered in rust) I have been carrying
customer_reviews.author: Floridave

customer_reviews.title: No bag was included as described.
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive the bag that description said came with item. I bought it as a gift and there is no bag to put the to set in.
customer_reviews.author: World Coffee Lover

customer_reviews.title: Handy gift for serious biker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother to use with his new fat bike. His eyes lit up when I gave it to him and he was impressed with the small size and obvious quality. He said it could replace a lot of the individual tools he carries. He is a biking fanatic, having numerous different types of high end bikes and this review is a reflection of his reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Snowgirl50

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light, well-made little toolset for on-bike carry
customer_reviews.text: Slim, light but sturdy, sleek design, solid stainless steel, and has all the metric hex key sizes on my MTB. Used for the first time today to install new bar ends and move the brake levers and shifters over to make room. Light work, but the Allen keys fit precisely and the tool held up to significant force with no problem. Will have confidence carrying in the under seat bag, where it takes up almost no room. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Westchester, NY

customer_reviews.title: I've been very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this product. Its lightweight and versatile. Fits easily into my saddle bag. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zee S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Wish it came with an option to attach to a carbinder. The little sleeve it comes in is basically useless. It is light weight and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with my decision to purchase this tool
customer_reviews.text: I am new at bicycling, I was just a teenager last time I rode a bike. However, I got this tool so I would be prepared should I need one. I have only used it for attaching accessories to my bike. the tool comes in its own slip in pouch and is very compact. For what I have used and feel of the tool it seems very strong made. I'm very pleased with my decision to purchase this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best multitools around. Light weight, excellent material, good variety of tools for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: PEM

customer_reviews.title: Useful, well made
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and useful tool at a great price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: REHi

customer_reviews.title: Most important tool in your messenger backpack or sling.
customer_reviews.text: I was watching a video from a person I am subscribing to and made a video of what’s in her bike messenger backpack. She pulled this toolkit and said lots of great things about.
customer_reviews.author: azriel724

customer_reviews.title: Could use some cushion or more comfortable grip feel as you tighten with it but overall ...
customer_reviews.text: Compact and well built. Solid feel and customer service followed up right after I received my item to provide tips and recommendations and further assistance if needed. Could use some cushion or more comfortable grip feel as you tighten with it but overall construction is good and provides adequate torque.
customer_reviews.author: Michael de Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great size and it really works!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the compact size. It fits in my saddle bag without taking up much room, but more importantly it works well. The size enables me to use it in spots the regular sized one could not be used. Well work the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Nice and lightweight with just the essential tools you need ...
customer_reviews.text: Handy little tool. Nice and lightweight with just the essential tools you need to tighten/untighten any bolts you might need while on the road. The smartly designed tool doesn't take up much space and you can slip it in your pocket or underseat bag and forget about it until you need it. The included carrying case is a nice touch!
customer_reviews.author: Buster71

customer_reviews.title: Multi tool review
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm VERY satisfied with this product. I did find it a bit cumbersome to use in tight spots (mounting my water bottle holder, for example). However, I really appreciate that this is a low profile tool, one that's easy to carry in my jersey pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hager

customer_reviews.title: This is a REALLY NICE product. It's small and strong
customer_reviews.text: This is a REALLY NICE product. It's small and strong, pictures don't do it justice. Great industrial design; high quality stainless steel, yet small and light.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike tool!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and extremely durable, one of the best designs for an onboard tool I have seen. This company makes well designed products, and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: swtnjc

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but very solid. Easy to use. Wish each tool can somehow be locked in place to eliminate possibility of shifting when in use. If that was in place I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool of High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool as it appears to be of excellent quality and has just the right amount of tension to keep the tools compacted. Not much else to say about it other than it looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Schleis

customer_reviews.title: A great tool at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is extremely functional and handy. It is very compact and takes little room in my kitbag on the back of my bike. The price is easy on the pocketbook and is a great value given the quality of the product! I'm very pleased with this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Career Soldier

customer_reviews.title: A very good tool
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tool and especially appreciate the product support by Pro Bike Tool. The tool is very compact and lite but also very sturdy. I live in Florida so things will rust very quickly. The tool looks like it is very capable of not rusting and will last for a long time. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Pave 53

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a christmas gift for my husband who is a bike nut. It's a nice tool, compact, easy to stash in a bike bag under the seat to take along. This tool makes it easier carrying than taking a bunch of individual tools. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: In the past i bought a cheap bike multitool becauae theres not much to these. This one is different. Its only 1/4" thick, so it takes up less space. The tools spring a bit into place so when you are using them they dint keep flipping around. Its more comfortable to hold. And it really is nice looking, obviously good quality metal.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Glicksman

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This item is so well made its quite impressive and does the job well. Buy this product. I'm a hard man to please but this one takes the cake.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Brant

customer_reviews.title: This tool is sleek & compact with no wasted space, much more so than my current Crank ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool is sleek & compact with no wasted space, much more so than my current Crank Brothers tool. It has less Allen wrench sizes, but is considerable more compact & lighter. I'm big on function over form for my pack. I can't say I'm looking forward to my next breakdown, but I am looking forward to using this tool. As long as it's strong enough to satisfy my "in the field" requirements, it will quickly become my primary bike tool.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Marsh

customer_reviews.title: The price was right. It arrived very quickly. ...
customer_reviews.text: The price was right. It arrived very quickly. I haven't actually used it yet, but it appears to be very well constructed. I think it will last forever. The shape is such that it will ride well in my seat back.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: No nonsense beautiful bike tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this simple little tool! The tools spring into position, the handling is easy, and the stainless steel looks great. So compact and practical. So simple to use. Fantastic price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Clark

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed at the small size, but it is very nice and sturdy. My other bike tool had plastic holding the tools together and broke in half. I've used this twice and feel like it's going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: This tool exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the quality of this tool. When I unpackaged it, I could tell it was engineered to be a tool to last a life time. The way it’s built reminds me of high-grade surgical tools. It has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: G. K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: nice and small to fit in my pack
customer_reviews.text: As described, nice and small to fit in my pack, or even pocket, for rides, but functional.
customer_reviews.author: David Jenkinson

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and compact. Slips out of case easily but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: openmind

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight bike tool !!
customer_reviews.text: Great compact lightweight bike tool with almost everything you need. If it had a one more feature such as a tool that you could put a 1/4" drive sockets on it would be even better than it already is!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Thibault

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had occasion to use it yet, but it's a very nice, sleek, compact stainless multi tool. Feels good in the hand, comes with a sleeve to protect it in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlizzie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, smaller than it looks in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, smaller than it looks in the picture, came with a nice case. I've used it a few times and it doesn't strip anything either - at least craftsman level and certainly not harbor freight.
customer_reviews.author: Erik S.

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and useful tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and useful tool! It has all the basics that you might need. I supplement mine with a mini chain breaker and a leatherman (for off the bike cutting/pliers needs). This tool is light enough with the bonus of not having to worry about rust.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is for my husband who repairs and restores bikes. He is thrilled with it as it it so well made, light weight and portable. Thank you so much for making this available.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Kirwan

customer_reviews.title: A great value!
customer_reviews.text: A very slim, strong and lightweight option for road bikers that want to be prepared for most anything on their rides. A great value!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and feels solid enough
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and feels solid enough. I haven't used it yet but I look forward to riding with a wee bit more confidence knowing I will be able to handle small repairs with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compact tool
customer_reviews.text: very compact, yet sturdy - great tool to carry under your seat -- will fit in your smallest saddle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Maxridge

customer_reviews.title: Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tool. Appears extremely well made, and I like the fact as to how slim it is. Comes in a little protective case. It'll be in my little bag of tricks on the road now.
customer_reviews.author: keywestnut

product_meta.title: PRO BIKE TOOL Bike Multitool 8 in 1 Reliable, Compact and Lightweight Repair Kit for Road and Mountain Bikes. Strong Full Stainless Steel, No Rust, Long Leverage Bicycle Tools, Includes Bag.
feature_bullets: RELIABLE & BUILT TO LAST multi tool - Cold forged SUS420 stainless steel for high strength and durability.
SLIM, COMPACT AND LIGHTWEIGHT bicycle tool kit. Only 0.3 inches thick, 3.7 inches long & lightweight at 3.6oz.

SAFELY TIGHTEN BOLTS, EVEN THE TOUGHEST ONES! 8 long leverage tools: Allen / Hex Tool 2.5/3/4/5/6, Star Shaped/Hex Tool T25/T30 and Phillips Tool PH1 cross drive. Auto indexing feature ensures tools lock into place when tightening.
SLIM, STYLISH & DISCREET BAG included to safely protect the bike tool. Check out our ‘Buying Guide' video in the ‘Related Video Shorts’ section.
PRO QUALITY - We’re so confident about the quality of our products that if you have any product issues, we’re very happy to either provide a Refund or a Replacement!
